title: [Large-scale] Synchronous Online Language Teacher Professional Development: Integrating Reflective Practice with Actual Language Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in online education and foundational language instruction competencies (basic grammar understanding, vocabulary teaching methods, reading activity design)
context.additional_context: A teacher training program in language education conducted in a smartphone-based limited-technology environment. Focuses on improving learners' writing skills and communicative expression abilities, with an emphasis on lesson design utilizing diverse language materials (text, audio, visual).

learning_goals: Participants can apply technical competencies (video conferencing tools, real-time interaction management) with 80%+ accuracy in synchronous online language classes to enhance learnersâ€™ speaking/listening skills.

Participants can produce one+ language lesson designs improved through peer feedback and self-reflection, focusing on social competencies (learning atmosphere creation, cultural sensitivity), including text-based activities and vocabulary expansion strategies.

Participants can analyze real language class cases to derive three+ improvement strategies (e.g., grammar explanation methods, reading activity diversification, expressive fluency enhancement) and implement them in simulated lessons.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
